column4: Ubuntu has mountd my XP ntfs partition but I can't access it with the command line or gnome, what do i need to do to make it work?
the msg you just got should help with reading your ntfs partition
check to be sure you got the right deb from opera
I did aptitutde install libqt3-mt xlibs , and opera*shared*etch installed fine
wierd, i haev both those packages and it still died :)
and opera sure looks different to me now :)
add multiverse to every line that has universe in it
the package I got for ubuntu was opera_8.51-20051114.6-shared-qt_en_etch_i386.deb
off the website (I hit the green button)
thanks, its locking up the sytem when it runs, tho I'm wondering if the HDD is on the blink :/
I start work at 7:30, which is when anacron starts up updatedb ; personally it's an annoyance until I alter anacron's start time but it never locked up anything
maybe, um a silly question: you do have dma enabled (I get bit by this on every install)
I have no idea, but it hasnt done this before and I think it is doing it on windows now
check out smartmontools , they report potential disk failures
may you have the same results I did: nothing wrong :)
